message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with action recognition in videos, which is a problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a new video descriptor and a new method to handle intra-class variations, which involves sparse coding techniques. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper deals with video data, which falls under the sub-category of multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper proposes a novel scheme to quantify relative intra and inter-class similarities among local temporal patterns arising in the videos, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
